6.27.18  2:37 am   Ok, so in a lot of your recent videos you bring up the theme of not being welcome at home, or it not being fun there. in your video "outside" you say " I can't go back to where I come from; Cuz I'm not welcome; and its not fun there" I know a lot of song writers write lyrics that coincide with their thoughts and feelings, and I wanted to ask you if that applies to this situation? (does this or does this not reflect things that happened to you?)

6.26.18  9:57 am   did you watch the Korean summit on TV, if so, did you like it (I thought that the handshake was the best part)?

6.26.18  9:57 am   i've never really been interested in making original music even though i listen to music a lot and enjoy playing other artists' songs on piano and ukulele from time to time. i also like singing a lot although i'm not too good of a singer. Sometimes i record those "covers" i make with my phone and listen to them again and again (egoistic??). however, ilve recently liked the idea of original music more. i have an ipad with garageband, a crappy ukulele, and my voice. could this be the start?

6.26.18  9:52 am   it's finally summer vacation and i'm really excited to finally get going on allotting all of my time to 'building an empire,' since all during the school year i have to focus on adhering to someone else's curriculum. yet i'm still anxious because i know when summer ends and i get back to school (i'm going into 11th grade) i'm going to have to start interacting with others again, and i don't know how to be nice and genuine with others while still socially isolating myself to have as much time as possible to get done the stuff i want to get done (i don't want to mislead others into thinking i'm interested in spending more time with them than i do). you seem to live a solitary lifestyle and i'm wondering: how did you handle this when you were in school or at least when you had to be around people on a frequent basis? thanks.
